column1: Biden is currently polling at 43.10%, while Trump is at 43.70%.

The closest states are Florida (5.65% Biden, 94.35% Trump), Iowa (8.34% Biden, 91.66% Trump), Arizona (15.52% Biden, 84.48% Trump), North Carolina (18.84% Biden, 81.16% Trump), Nevada (23.15% Biden, 76.85% Trump), Georgia (24.13% Biden, 75.87% Trump), Michigan (31.12% Biden, 68.88% Trump), Wisconsin (32.41% Biden, 67.59% Trump), Pennsylvania (40.36% Biden, 59.64% Trump), Nebraska CD-2 (42.91% Biden, 57.09% Trump), Maine (60.71% Biden, 39.29% Trump), New Hampshire (63.23% Biden, 36.77% Trump), Minnesota (67.82% Biden, 32.18% Trump), Virginia (71.50% Biden, 28.50% Trump), New Mexico (83.48% Biden, 16.52% Trump), Colorado (91.64% Biden, 8.36% Trump), Oregon (92.86% Biden, 7.14% Trump), New Jersey (94.74% Biden, 5.26% Trump), Rhode Island (94.84% Biden, 5.16% Trump).
Biden has an 32.27% chance of winning the election, Trump has an 67.25% chance of winning the election, and there is an 0.48% chance of a tie.
Biden is expected to win 240 electoral votes, while Trump is expected to win 298 electoral votes.
